api_token.description: Logtail API Token. The value can be omitted if `LOGTAIL_API_TOKEN` environment variable is set. See https://docs.logtail.com/api/getting-started#obtaining-an-api-token on how to obtain the API token for your team.

ingesting_paused.description: This proparty allows you to temporarily pause data ingesting for this source (e.g., when you are reaching your plan's usage quota and you want to prioritize some sources over others).

platform.description:
The platform of this source. This value can be set only when you're creating a new source. You can't update this value later. Valid values are:
    `kubernetes`
	`docker`
	`ruby`
	`python`
	`javascript`
	`node`
	`logstash`
	`fluentbit`
	`fluentd`
	`rsyslog`
	`syslog-ng`
	`http`
	`vector`
	`heroku`
	`heroku_addon`
	`ubuntu`
	`apache2`
	`nginx`
	`postgresql`
	`mysql`
	`mongodb`
	`redis`
	`cloudflare_worker`
	`flights`
	`dokku`

table_name.description: The table name generated for this source.

token.description: The token of this source. This token is used to identify and route the data you will send to Logtail.

block.description: This resource allows you to create, modify, and delete Logtail Sources. For more information about the Sources API check https://docs.logtail.com/api/sources-api

ingesting_paused.description: This proparty allows you to temporarily pause data ingesting for this source (e.g., when you are reaching your plan's usage quota and you want to prioritize some sources over others).

platform.description:
The platform of this source. This value can be set only when you're creating a new source. You can't update this value later. Valid values are:
    `kubernetes`

	`python`

table_name.description: The table name generated for this source.

token.description: The token of this source. This token is used to identify and route the data you will send to Logtail.

block.description: This Data Source allows you to look up existing Logtail Sources using their table name. The table name is shown on the Source settings page on Logtail.com or you can list all your existing sources via the [Sources API](https://docs.logtail.com/api/sources-api#get-sources).
